pr_title: [no-ticket][risk=no] addressing comments from another closed PR

timeline.message: adding changes per comments on PR.

timeline.bodyText: Refactored findOne to take conceptSetId and workspaceId to satisfy both calls and exceptions
timeline.author: freemabd

replies.bodyText: Cool. FWIW,  you could push this down. into the servcie as well, and have one method that returns an Optional<ConceptSet> and another that throws your exception. Since you're doing this twice, that might clean. up. your controller code.
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Reverted this and made 2 different methods on service.
replies.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: Removed the conditional because findAll return an empty collection of no concept Ids match.
timeline.author: freemabd

replies.bodyText: Yes, and you drop a ! for the win.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: @jaycarlton added your recommended builder pattern to help construction.
timeline.author: freemabd

replies.bodyText:
Awesome!  You can.  also make. a. vaildation function check required args are present or throw.
nit: I'm used to see the work happen in build(), there's. no reason it can't work this way.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: Test to assert that findAll return empty collection when nothing is found.
timeline.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: maybe name this one. existingConceptSet. It can be final (nit)
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Why not include this function in. your ConceptSEtMapper?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText:
^
I think it should be possible but I'd be OK with waiting until there is a mapper for Concept as well.
I think with that addition, it would be a lot easier for MapStruct to infer the Long -> Concept mapping pattern.
I'm just not sure if it will automatically pick figure out the transitive relationship of Long -> DbConcept -> Concept if it knows how to do Long -> DbConcept and DbConcept -> Concept.
As is, I believe you'd have to use an AfterMapping annotation since the static method of ConceptsController.toClientConcept can't be provided through DI.
replies.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: Transitive, invisible conversion chains scare me a bit. This is why C++ has explicit constructors. The rare cases where it runs away from you are scary. Much less scary with less common types.
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: I agree with Eric. I will file a ticket for this work: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-4451
replies.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: This looks very similar to toClientConceptSetWithConcepts. Could you make a service method that takes in a sort order and unify some of this?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Since you're. ignoring the concepts field, you can make a helper method that knows how to do what  you need. See e.g. org.pmiops.workbench.utils.WorkspaceMapper#afterWorkspaceIntoResearchPurpose()
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: this can be done with this ticket: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-4451
replies.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: nit: maybe. just findByConcept..., to match. the others. teh return type indicates. you're only getting one.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Done, also added Test class for ConceptSetDaoTest since it didn't exist.
replies.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: [please change] I wouldn't put int-to-string mappings in CommonMappers, because you might get false positives with other types. I.e.  MapStruct doesn't know that these are etag-specific.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.author: freemabd

replies.bodyText: That looks like a great solution to me.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.message: add new service call and refactored service call per comments.
rename of dao method and adding test clase for ConceptSetDaoTest.
adding qualifier names to common mappers methods.

timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: 💯 for pulling daos out of the controller.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText:
It's confusing to see a method name. with no verb unless it's on a builder. I was thinking this was a getConcepts() method at first.
aside: I'm starting to wonder if this controller needs a broader name: some of. these methods don't talk about datasets at all.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Yes, Data Sets, Concept Sets and Cohort Builder will be more interchangeable in the future and the lines will start to blur a bit.
replies.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: I think you can return an iterable from. here if that's helpful, for example if the result set is very long.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Seems that we have a cap on how many a user can select: https://github.com/all-of-us/workbench/blob/freemabd/address-comments/api/src/main/java/org/pmiops/workbench/api/ConceptSetsController.java#L51-L51
replies.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: aside: I could've sworn another mapper already had one of these...
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: I moved them from WorkspaceMapper into CommonMappers
replies.author: freemabd

timeline.bodyText: Can you test the other direction? Or is that not implemented yet?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText:
It's not implemented yet. I created a ticket for it: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-4455
It's a little more involved than just copy over ConceptSet to DbConceptSet. So I want to think about it a bit... needs to hit BQ with proper OMOP table to get counts.

timeline.bodyText: is this an automatic ID? If so, then why specify it?
